metadata.Title: CVE-2020-2732 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was discovered in the way that the KVM hypervisor handledinstruction emulation for an L2 guest when nested virtualisation isenabled. Under some circumstances, an L2 guest may trick the L0 guest intoaccessing sensitive L1 resources that should be inaccessible to the L2guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-5.4.0-18-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-generic - 5.4.0-18.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-18-lowlatency - 5.4.0-18.22
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-18.22').
linux-kvm package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1004.4').
linux-aws package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').
linux-azure package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1006.6').
linux-gcp package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').
linux-oracle package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1005.5').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was pending').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1007.7').
